alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale; Geneva (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 25 at 4:03AM CST until January 25 at 5:15AM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Dale County in southeastern Alabama... Coffee County in southeastern Alabama... Geneva County in southeastern Alabama... * Until 515 AM CST. * At 403 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Glenwood to near Florala, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Daleville, Elba, Geneva, Enterprise, Fort Rucker, Ozark, Level Plains, Samson, Newton, New Brockton, Ariton, Lee, Clayhatchee, Kinston, Coffee Springs, Carl Folsom A/p, Hooper Stage Field, Gerald, Camp Humming Hills and Cairns Aaf. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CST for southeastern Alabama...and the Panhandle of Florida. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee.
